  13. /**************************************************************************/

  15. /* Runtime Builder's Swiss Army Knife. This utility performs functions
  16.    previously delegated to classic Unix utilities but which ultimately seem to
  17.    cause more hassle for maintenance than the initial simplicity suggests.

  19.    This tool is a memorial to the many hours and PRs spent chasing down strange
  20.    locale issues, stray CR characters and fighting yet another incompatible
  21.    implementation of sed or awk. */

  23. /* Borrow the Unicode *_os definitions and T() macro from misc.h */
  24. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS
  25. #include "caml/misc.h"

  27. #include <stdio.h>
  28. #include <string.h>
  29. #include <ctype.h>

  31. #ifdef _WIN32
  32. ‌#define strncmp_os wcsncmp
  33. ‌#define toupper_os towupper
  34. ‌#define printf_os wprintf
  35. #else
  36. ‌#define strncmp_os strncmp
  37. /* NOTE: See CAVEATS section in https://man.netbsd.org/ctype.3 */
  38. /* and NOTE section in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/toupper.3.html */
  39. ‌#define toupper_os(x) toupper((unsigned char)x)
  40. ‌#define printf_os printf
  41. #endif

  43. /* Operations
  44.    - encode-C-literal. Used for the OCAML_STDLIB_DIR macro in
  45.      runtime/build_config.h to ensure the LIBDIR make variable is correctly
  46.      represented as a C string literal.

  48.      On Unix, `sak encode-C-literal /usr/local/lib` returns `"/usr/local/lib"`

  50.      On Windows, `sak encode-C-literal "C:\OCamlüê´\lib"` returns
  51.      `L"C:\\OCaml\xd83d\xdc2b\\lib"`
  52.    - add-stdlib-prefix. Used in stdlib/StdlibModules to convert the list of
  53.      basenames given in STDLIB_MODULE_BASENAMES to the actual file basenames
  54.      in STDLIB_MODULES.

  56.      For example, `sak add-stdlib-prefix stdlib camlinternalAtomic Sys` returns
  57.      ` stdlib camlinternalAtomic stdlib__Sys`
  58. */

  60. ‌void usage(void)
  61. {
  62.   printf(
  63.     "OCaml Build System Swiss Army Knife\n"
  64.     "Usage: sak command\n"
  65.     "Commands:\n"
  66.     " * encode-C-literal path - encodes path as a C string literal\n"
  67.     " * add-stdlib-prefix name1 ... - prefix standard library module names\n"
  68.   );
  69. }

  71. /* Converts the supplied path (UTF-8 on Unix and UCS-2ish on Windows) to a valid
  72.    C string literal. On Windows, this is always a wchar_t* (L"..."). */
  73. ‌void encode_C_literal(char_os *path)
  74. {
  75.   char_os c;

  77. #ifdef _WIN32
  78.   putchar('L');
  79. #endif
  80.   putchar('"');

  82.   while ((c = *path++) != 0) {
  83.     /* Escape \, " and \n */
  84.     if (c == '\\') {
  85.       printf("\\\\");
  86.     } else if (c == '"') {
  87.       printf("\\\"");
  88.     } else if (c == '\n') {
  89.       printf("\\n");
  90. #ifndef _WIN32
  91.     /* On Unix, nothing else needs escaping */
  92.     } else {
  93.       putchar(c);
  94. #else
  95.     /* On Windows, allow 7-bit printable characters to be displayed literally
  96.        and escape everything else (using the older \x notation for increased
  97.        compatibility, rather than the newer \U. */
  98.     } else if (c < 0x80 && iswprint(c)) {
  99.       putwchar(c);
  100.     } else {
  101.       printf("\\x%04x", c);
  102. #endif
  103.     }
  104.   }

  106.   putchar('"');
  107. }

  109. /* Print the given array of module names to stdout. "stdlib" and names beginning
  110.    "camlinternal" are printed unaltered. All other names are prefixed "stdlib__"
  111.    with the original name capitalised (i.e. "foo" prints "stdlib__Foo"). */
  112. ‌void add_stdlib_prefix(int count, char_os **names)
  113. {
  114.   int i;
  115.   char_os *name;

  117.   for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
  118.     name = *names++;

  120.     /* "stdlib" and camlinternal* do not get changed. All other names get
  121.        capitalised and prefixed "stdlib__". */
  122.     if (strcmp_os(T("stdlib"), name) == 0
  123.      || strncmp_os(T("camlinternal"), name, 12) == 0) {
  124.       printf_os(T(" %s"), name);
  125.     } else {
  126.       /* name is a null-terminated string, so an empty string simply has the
  127.          null-terminator "capitalised". */
  128.       *name = toupper_os(*name);
  129.       printf_os(T(" stdlib__%s"), name);
  130.     }
  131.   }
  132. }

  134. ‌int main_os(int argc, char_os **argv)
  135. {
  136.   if (argc == 3 && !strcmp_os(argv[1], T("encode-C-literal"))) {
  137.     encode_C_literal(argv[2]);
  138.   } else if (argc > 1 && !strcmp_os(argv[1], T("add-stdlib-prefix"))) {
  139.     add_stdlib_prefix(argc - 2, &argv[2]);
  140.   } else {
  141.     usage();
  142.     return 1;
  143.   }

  145.   return 0;
  146. }
